page.title: 06POLICE AND MAGISTRATES COURT
page.content: Chester-le-Street Police are part of Durham County Constabulary.The HQ is at Aykley Heads in Durham City.The Chester-le-Street division has 100 officers ,24 cars and 6 dogs.It covers all of North West Durham .The new police station was built in 1969, replacing the old one in Front Street.The Police here deal with over 11,000 incidents a year. The Magistrates' Court is part of the Police station.After committing a crime the accused is held in one of three kinds of cell:-juvenile,female or male.Each have a bench,a mattress, blanket,toilet,and a light.A defendant liable to escape is led through an underground tunnel to the court.There are 3 courts and once inside the defendant is tried by 3 magistrates.
